description.overview: This course introduces fundamental concepts of Artificial Intelligence (AI), its applications and use cases across various industries. It is designed for learners with little or no background in AI and does not require programming skills.
major_instructional_areas: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and real-world applications
Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Neural Networks concepts
IBM Watson AI services and chatbot development
additional_learning: Exploring AI use cases in business and customer service

student_tasks.task: Complete all courses in the AI Foundations for Everyone specialization on Coursera.
student_tasks.related_policy: Must obtain certification to be eligible for final exam.

student_tasks.task: Participate in no-code hands-on exercises and chatbot development activities.

clos.description: Understand what is AI, its applications and use cases, its ethical considerations and how it is transforming our lives.
Explain underlying concepts related to Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Neural Networks.
Explore common generative AI models and tools for text, code, image, audio, and video generation.
Explore commonly used tools for prompt engineering.
Visually create chatbots with Watson Assistant and deploy them on a website.

additional_learning_materials.title: Building AI Powered Chatbots Without Programming

assessment_config.completion_criteria: Final TE Score >= 4 and (Final TE Score + bonus) >= 5
assessment_config.knowledge_skill_focus: AI concepts, generative AI, prompt engineering, chatbot development
assessment_config.notes: Customized from quizzes of the AI Foundations for Everyone specialization.

academic_rules.academic_integrity: Students must follow Coursera Code of Conduct and university academic integrity policies.

source: Official syllabus + Coursera AI Foundations for Everyone
